What to Expect Tesla is seeking an amazing software engineering intern to contribute to the Gigafactory Berlin, Manufacturing Test Engineering team. As a member of our team, you will shape the direction of next generation core manufacturing automation systems at Tesla. You must have a genuine passion for engineering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and thrive working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. Develop software applications to support release of test equipment for new super charging & battery pack product.
Write software for automated test machinery embedded in high volume production lines.
Deploy scalable software solutions typical to manufacturing and power electronics.
Implement novel, highly efficient software technologies to improve product throughput and reliability.
Collaborate with electrical, firmware, and mechanical design engineers throughout product life cycle (from product inception to mass production) to debug and improve products.

Proficient in modern system technologies such as gRPC, GraphQL and SQL.
Proficient in system-level languages such as C, C++, Golang, used for the development of machinery.
Studying BS or MS in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or the equivalent in experience with evidence of exceptional ability.
Fluent in software fundamentals including software design, backend infrastructure, code modularity and maintainability.

Possess strong communication skills and a preference for delivering as part of a team.

Deutsche Bank Technology Centre in Berlin

In the division of Corporate Management, we work on the design and implementation of innovative concepts for value creation processes in companies, management, and the development of methods and software tools to support corporate planning and control.

As part of a small, agile team of developers, you will further develop existing software solutions in the area of process management.

You bring diligence and reliability, but also commitment and team spirit.

We value flexible working hours, independent work and room for your own ideas.
